description:
In function run_tests:
  # Cleanup *pyc
  ${wrapper} find . -type f -name "*.pyc" -delete

If venv is enabled, ${wrapper} is set to 'tools/with_venv.sh' and with_venv.sh passes unquoted *.pyc to find.

Normally this is not a problem; no pyc is in the current directory, so *.pyc is passed to find as is.

But, if a pyc, say x.pyc, is in the current directory, the command executed is:
    find . -type f -name x.pyc -delete
In this case, find runs without error. But no pyc is deleted apart from x.pyc.

If two(or more) pyc, say x.pyc and y.pyc, are in the current directory, the command executed is:
    find . -type f -name x.pyc y.pyc -delete
In this case, find fails with error 'find: y.pyc: unknown option', and run_tests.sh also fails.

To remove ${wrapper} from the line solves the problem?
title: run_tests.sh with venv fails if *.pyc exists in the current directory
